headline: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) Faces Class Action Over Transmission Issues in Canada
summary: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) recently faced a proposed class action lawsuit in Vancouver over its 10R80 10-speed transmission, highlighting significant legal challenges. While the company recorded a flat share price move over the past month, broader market turmoil contributed to its performance. The global trade tensions, marked by new tariffs leading to a decline in major indices like the Dow and S&P 500, overshadowed individual company performance across sectors, including the auto industry. Given...

headline: China announces retaliatory tariffs, U.S. unemployment rises: Morning Buzz
summary: The major averages were sharply lower again near noon, continuing yesterday’s post-tariff slide. China has retaliated with additional tariffs of 34% on all U.S. goods a day after the Trump administration imposed its own sweeping levies. Meanwhile, the latest U.S. jobs data show that nonfarm payrolls rose by a higher-than-forecast 228,000 jobs, though the unemployment rate has ticked higher. Looking to commodities, oil prices are sharply lower due to a planned output increase promised by OPEC+ as

headline: How Trump’s Tariffs Will Affect Corporate Earnings
summary: Christine Short, head of research of TMX Group's Wall Street Horizon, joins WSJ’s Take On the Week podcast to share what to look out for this earnings season as tariffs come into play.

headline: Auto industry: Why it's an 'unfortunate time' for tariffs to hit
summary: Auto stocks, including Ford (F), General Motors (GM), and Stellantis (STLA), are all under pressure as companies feel the weight of Trump's tariffs. Kevin Roberts, CarGurus director of industry insights and analytics, joins Asking for a Trend to discuss tariffs' effects on the auto industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.
